topic: How to design web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing Web Backends Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of how to create efficient and scalable web APIs using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is based on standard Python type hints, making it easy to write intuitive, error-free APIs.
It includes automatic API documentation and OpenAPI support.
FastAPI provides advanced features like middleware, request validation, and more.
Integrates seamlessly with popular databases (SQLAlchemy) and authentication libraries.

code_examples.code:
from pydantic import BaseModel
class Item(BaseModel):
 name: str
 description: str
available_items = [{"name": "Foo", "description": "Bar"}]

version_notes: FastAPI 0.70.0 and above is compatible with Python 3.12.
caveats: FastAPI requires Python >= 3.7. As of now, Python 3.12 is in alpha stage. This explainer is based on the expectation that FastAPI will be compatible with Python 3.12 when it moves out of alpha.
Ensure your development environment and dependencies are updated to support Python 3.12.
